poem:
### Dawn over Jammu

Sirens slice through  
the morning mist—  
a drone's shadow  
dances on walls  
of borrowed light.  
  
In trembling silence,  
the garden pauses,  
petals poised  
on whispered  
promises—  
  
Roses,  
crimson and  
innocent,  
breathe the air,  
awaiting their turn  
to bloom.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Explosions reported in Jammu city in India-administered Kashmir – live updates 5.52pm BST We reported earlier that there were reports of explosions, blackouts and sirens in the city of Jammu in Indian-administered Kashmir. Indian military sources told Reuters they suspected a Pakistani drone attack across the region, with several parts of Jammu and the surrounding towns of Akhnoor, Samba and Kathua affected. An Indian official told the news agency: Our army installations are under attack,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
